column4: hey i just installed ubuntu 6.06lts, i know if i change my IP which is currently getting it's net info via DHCP it will break sudo. how should i go about preventing breaking sudo when i want to change my IP?
so how can i switch ips without breaking SUDO
what? are you logged in to same box now?
you use it as sudo .. not as sudo su...
i dont know what the side effects of that is, someone here earlier mentioned something bout a side effect which i already forget
how do i install the new kernel?
I use the synaptic manager to get an update, anyhow i cant afford a 64bit yet..so not sure if its that much different
i try but it says. The following packages have been kept back:
you are in a 64bit world, am not familiar with. sorry i cant assist
also try to prefix your responses with the nick of the person you're talking to
man i love how this 606 LTS server wont be changed for soooo long
well there's still updates...i cant keep up myself
dxdt, ok i'm switching my IP in the network config area. going to reboot then i'll show you the error message
wait a minute you are just sudo to a user? why do you get networking stuff? you are not going beyond a login locally noh?
i dont know then, i have not had a dual core or dual cpu..
